reviews.review_msg: If you have him for studio physics, drop the course and take it elsewhere. The experiments were useless and the self directed learning did nothing but muddle everyone in the class. Help was available, but but not useful, and his exams were far harder than anything we encountered in class. Do not take his class.

She was a well-spoken prof and did well explaining the challenging material. I took it as a requirement and she did a good enough job. I took this course when COVID was still an issue and only the exams were in-person. Kinda scary doing it that way tbh

I really like Dr. Johnson. She is really good at explaining concepts and I got a lot out of her lectures. Her midterms have easy written questions similar to the assignments. The multiple choice was hard but she is a really good prof and enjoys teaching. Definitely take the class with her!

Dr. J is very knowledgeable, organized, and her lectures are well planned. Tests were incredibly fair, but she does give a lot of online homework where you will need to find some information on your own. Written homework is designed to be easy. Overall, she's a good prof who makes it easy to do well in her class.

While lectures are not helpful, she more than makes up for it in her office hour. She is very willing to go over textbook problems and draw diagrams to explain her concepts. Physics courses are all self-study which is why they seem so hard. 100% recommend getting the textbook and reading from it, it will go a long way

Sarah has straightforward notes that give you a good base of learning for the key concepts. The rest of the learning is up to you - be ready to self-teach. Tests were fair and the written questions were very similar to the written homework. Sarah is a good prof if you can self-teach well and do all the homework.

Sarahs lectures may have not been that informative however her notes provide you with the basis needed for most topics. Tutorials are mandatory for a reason and the tutorial worksheets do help with understanding if you have a good TA. Written homeworks are guaranteed to be your midterm and final long answer problems, Exams were fair but tricky MC
notes don't help with mastering physics' questions...
Had her for phys 101 as well -- hard but she gives you a lot of opportunities that help bring your mark up if you do the work for it. exams are fair.

Wasn't hard if youy take her notes study and use the textbook for practice. Class average on exam 1 was 58% for some reason tho.. and i got 96%. I found she wasn't very friendly and didnt like being put on the spot or answering questions. she would say ask the ta or check canvas instead of answering often. came off rude to me when i asked simple Qs

I hate the prelecture questions. These questions are not jest for completion, they occupy 5% of the final mark. So you better get the right answer.  She expect you to understand the concept before you come the lecture. If i can understand by myself, then why do i need to pay u for the lectures?

Multiple choice questions are tricky! I got full mark on written and lost a lot of marks on MC.  She did her best to make the class interesting, but did not met what I wanted. She shows actual experiments quite often, but I guess she should show more practice problems instead of spending the time on them.

lectures are useless better of going to khan academy only went to class for i clicker points. my overall grade is 45% and im a B  student with minimal effort in all my classes. Tutorials where also useless.  If you take this class be prepared to teach yourself all the material.
Very clear, very fair grading. Can't ask for more.
she says 'okay" way too many times...

I think she's a good prof. She does a good job of testing us on concepts, and doesn't ask random obscure exam questions. But you really need to make sure you understand the material, and budget your time accordingly on the midterms. Overall, I would recommend taking Physics with her.
She's a pretty good instructor. Approachable and friendly. Fairly easy exams. I liked her as my teacher.
she was really good... reallyl liked her... as long as u do ur homework ull be fine...
First midterm was a little long and class average fell. Other than that she's a good prof in my opinion, nothing exciting, just good.

Although i got an A, i dun like her a bit. Her writing is awful. In her lecture, it is like taking an eye test to c how many words u can actually read. Basically, all u hv to do is read the text book and wish god bless u.

how are we supposed to learn from a prof who gets confused reading from her own notes!!!! grading scheme is completely unfair... doesn't seem to want to help students... we had to argue with her to put up the answers to practice midterms and finals and she still didn't!!! its like she wants to see us fail!!!

I think she is one of those profs who is there just for the research and not to teach. Doesn't seem like she cares how students do in her class. Take the ~50% average and the fact the doesn't post answer keys to practice exams when she know help will be hard to find during exam week. All in all and terrible prof if you value your grades.

I've learned what I can from the book and that's about it. It's kind of hard to take her seriously when she thought e=1/2mc^2 or when she has to backtrack on her OWN example. I just hope my GPA doesn't take a beating from this course...Good luck to those who will be taking her.

Oh my....hardest class ever. Not the material, but the prof. If I could have given a 0 for easiness I would have. If you value your gpa I would stay as far away from her classes as you can. Seems to know a lot, but isn't very helpful or open to student suggestions.

she's nice and kind, but VERY bad at teaching. I would recommend staying away from this prof. Also, her exams are very unfair, and they're more like essays rather than calculations. I regret taking this class this semester
She is hard, but knowledgeable

I like the way this professor challenges her students. The more you are challenged, the better you will learn;instead of complaining about your failure and toughness of the course,try to find ways to exceed this challenge.
not a very good prof. very difficult hw and test and isnt very helpful at all.
she's good. better than lots of physics profs i've had.
impossible homework and tests
homework and exams are super hard
her hw is hard! standard teacher...nothing special
Good course. I never really liked Physics, but now I feel like I can do it, lol... most exam questions are related to stuff covered during lecture, so just make sure you know that material well.
Really nice guy! Always considered our feedback and cared - tests were really hard but got scaled. Wish I had taken the class in-person...
Great class, despite being online! He brought in demos and lots of examples. Tests were really hard though - he said to prevent cheating, but were scaled. Overall good experience.

Dr. Stelzer is always ready to help. He made it a point to take student feedback from time to time to make sure that his class was benefitting everyone. The first two midterms were fair but the last midterm and final was very long (but it was heavily scaled). He does a lot of examples in class but the course itself needs quite some practice.
I think he likes teaching and it shows. I used to hate Physics, now I understand and actually don't mind it. The exams are hard but get scaled. Highly recommend taking the class.

Dr. Stelzer is a very nice person but sometimes confuses himself during lectures. The midterms were fine but the time limit made them really difficult. The final was just hard. But he ended up scaling the grades. Tutorials and homework problems were useful so make sure you make use of them. Overall an amazing prof.

He was a great professor and explained concepts really clearly! His midterms were extremely fair as long as you studied his notes and practice exams. Hes also really accessible outside of class and is super understanding and caring. Overall hes a great professor, and I would definitely take any course with him again.
Hey, I thought this was a fun course

The course ended up much like I expected it. But why throw in a super-hard exam when it gets scaled afterwards anyways? - it fried my brain!! Anyway, he is a good Prof. Enjoyed the lectures and would definitely take another class with him - but please get the exams right!
So Happy! Loved this guy with all the cool gear and gadgets in class.. Wished I could have finished that darn exam. but all good.
What a roller coaster. Reeeeeeeeally tough exam, but fair grading!!! Nice Happy End!

RIP. The final exam was terrible and honestly not expected. The midterms were extremely fair; however, I am not sure why he made the final exam so hard. He is a good guy so do well on the midterms and pray for the final.

He's a nice guy but not the best lecturer. Fair midterms but the final was hard; the written questions weren't problems we were familiarized with through tutorials, mastering, or even written questions so i dont really get the point of those. Also, pre-lecter lec slides were inconsistent & i think we were missing a set of slides near the end

such a fun great course throughout the semester with fair midterms, however, final was the worse i have ever written and i studied for entire week, Questions were out of no where. DONT RECOMMEND UNLESS YOU WANT TO FAIL THE FINAL (40%)
Nice guy but super hard final!!!!!!!!!!
Friendly and accessible prof. Class gets scaled in the end. Prelecture quizzes, clicker, online homework is a pain but keeps you busy. I would take another class with him.
He does a lot of experiments and examples in class. I guess, know them well and you will excel... :) LOL

Only use the text for clarifying concepts. His notes are enough and the text is overkill. Attend tutorials. Study from written homework, tutorials and lecture examples. Cancel's out your worst lecture if you do better on final and attend tutorials. Has slight accent but you can definitely understand what he's saying. Nice, helpful and caring.

He is a fun prof and does a lot of examples, the only issue was that the midterm was way to long and many people couldn't even finish. Attend tutorials cause they are really helpful. participation matters cause there is clicker questions for marks.

His sense of humor is one where he doesn't try but somehow the entire is laughing. and we had a morning class. He made physics (which I already loved), a wonderful experience. Listen to him when he says "I reused exam questions....I use tutorial questions....I use lecture examples....." because he sure does!! Seriously loved him as a prof.

Exam questions straight from the tutorials, old midterms and written assignment questions, so pretty straightforward. Curved the average at the end of the semester. Overall a fair marker, but make sure you know the stuff he emphasizes in class because it will definitely come up in exams.

Super nice guy, genuinely wants his students to do well. Midterms + final were repeats of questions in homework assignments/lecture examples. Physics is not exactly my forte, yet I still managed to do relatively well in this course because he made his class average very high (around B-B+). If you hate physics, try to take it with him! Best prof.

Extremely helpful, lecture notes will contain examples of every type of question you'll encounter. Very clear, provides non-calculus versions of equations and solutions. Assignments very fair, midterms all from previously solved homework questions, no surprises there. Formula sheet given for tests, and released ahead of time. Super nice.

He's a good prof and a REALLY nice guy.His midterms are very easy as the m/c is identical to iclicker questions and the written questions are almost identical to mastering physics.The final is abit harder but not by much.Still alot of the questions are similar to assignments but a few require thinking.

Moved through the material very slowly, but thats cause he had a very dumb class to teach so he had to, very accesible for help, and explained things very clearly. Midterms were mostly made up of hw questions and final was basically the 2 midterms, plus some really hard questions, decent prof, would like to see more in class demoes though

Chen frequently retracts his statements in lecture which gives the distinct impression he doesn't really know what he's talking about.    His exam writing skills need work: he makes exams harder than lecture or practice material and ends up severely scaling midterms and finals. 60%=A.

Made a frustrating class even more frustrating. Gives difficult questions and when he explains how to do them, he skips steps so you have no idea what he's doing. I now hate physics and will never take it again.

The physics aside, he's actually quite a good professor.  He takes the comments from students into consideration.  The exams are a bit tricky, but it's nothing new that he throws at you.  Everything is either in the homework or he's gone over in lecture.

A prof who listens to student's complaint and willing to change his attitude.PPl who keep talking in class should learn how to respect a prof and other students.Before you judge a person, judge yourself first.
He give fair exams and reasonable schedule but writes horrible lecture notes... no use for him to upload to internet
She does not cover examples relative to exam and homework difficulty and is impossible to reach during office hours. have fun

I took Phys 102 in a lab setting and loved it. The professor was very accessible for questions and made sure you completely understood. The hands on learning made concepts easier to understand. Lots of homework given but the questions are very similar to test questions so although it was a lot it was very helpful. Generally just a nice person too!

I DIDNT FINISH in the other comment but she is actually really good. And always ready to help you even if you ask the stupidest qs everrr ( based on experience) DEFINETLY TAKE IT WITH HER plz YOU WILL LOVE HER AS MICH AS I DID . NOW I WISH YOU A GREAT PHYISCS SEM cuz there is no more physics for mebahababahaaaaha

GUYS dr.simin is the nicest phyiscs professor there is. Believe me when I say this because I HATE PHYISCS AND after physics 101 I was ready to die but taking phys 102 with her made physics a little less hard for me. Her exams are out of the homework and her recorded problem solving sessions SHE IS NOT TRICKING U. her mc are very conceptual tho

This is definitely the best way to take physics. She lectures for abt 30 mins of class then an activity for the other hour and a half which helped me learn way better. Lots of homework but it really helps with getting better with the material, she is very good at explaining concepts. Take with friends so they can be in your group for the activities

Lectures can often be very dry and feel like 50 minutes wasted. She often gets sidetracked and starts talking about other topics or her research, and doesn't do a great job of explaining more confusing concepts. However, if anything she's friendly and very easy to talk to, and will gladly give you extra help if you ask.

The class was going fine up until the final exam. This exam had questions that I could not have prepared for in any way or with any extra study time. The midterms were fair but written homework was always a mystery. She is a nice professor, quite likeable and available for help though I didn't use her as a resource but the final was brutal
Wow. Barbara is not teacher material. She makes things more confusing than need be, and on multiple occasions, the physics confused Barbara too. She doesn't understand her own examples.

If you are a good physics student, or have previous high school physics knowledge, then you might easily do good. However if you are not a good physics student then textbook will be your teacher. She was mainly disorganized, questioned herself during lect. Didn't explain concepts completely, HW was tough as hell plus MANY failed her exams

For those who are not naturally good at physics, this is a tough course. I found the textbook more relevant than her notes and didn't take much away from the lecture even though I went everyday and payed attention. Must study the tutorial questions for the exams. Not a lot of time to think during the exams, bit of a time crunch.

She made simple topics impossible... Her midterms went above and beyond what was taught in the class and she lacked any sort of organization. Overall, DO NOT TAKE WITH HER. She does make her final easier but after two devastating midterms for the class and a lack of understanding it's too little too late!

studying for my finals, i realized how little I knew in this course because of barbra. she constantly gets concepts mixed up and her notes are far from complete. the class averages for the midterm were less than 50%, which shows how little the lass knew. The only good thing is that she is treating us like me know nothing making the final easier!

She seems to have a high interest in the course and she seems intelligent but she is just horrible at teaching. Passing her course takes a lot more effort than it really should. The class average for both midterms has been around 50% and there is a reason for it

She really isn`t that bad...I thought she was good at explaining concepts (if you actually listened unlike most people) and I rarely touched the textbook. The midterms were both fair as they came right from stuff we did in tutorials.

She's not the greatest prof, but the people on here make it sound like she's completely useless. She's a nice person and her interest in Physics shows. She explains the concepts adequately but you will need to read the textbook and attend tutorials to succeed. Simply going to lecture won't get you an A. First year students need to stop complaining.

very confusing prof. her lectures are useless, study from the textbook. she frequently gets masteringphysics problems wrong and does not know how to solve questions when you bring them to her office hours.
Useless prof that cannot teach at all. Notes are very confusing and constantly confuse herself with her own clicker questions. If you don't want to fail, don't take this class with her.
Terrible. Do not take her

the fact the TA's teach better than her speaks volume about her teaching abilities. Tutorials are not optional but you should go because you'll learn 100 times more than you will in lecture. She is the worst explainer ever!
Terrible profs. Terrible jokes. Terrible is synomous with her name.
Bad bad bad teacher. Cannot give clear instructions and is a snorter! Do not take any courses with her!
She is very disorganized. She is probably very intelligent but she fails to communicate it to her students. She laughs at her own jokes and no one else does. Avoid this prof if you can.

Barbara is a very disorganized & poor at communicating concepts. Her notes, although handwritten, are confusing & misleading. The midterm was fair, but there was not nearly enough time for anybody to finish it. She is easily the worst prof I have ever encountered.

Completely useless professor. Does not know how to teach and sometimes gets confused herself on iclicker questions. I went to her office hours with a couple of textbook questions and she was not able to answer any of them
Dr. Frisken is not very helpful and is not clear on what she is discussing and very scatter brained. It is very frustrating taking a course with her!

Very hard to pay attention in this class. Her notes are confusing. The only reason people go to this class is to do iClicker questions. I think the only person who likes her is Marco Wan. You have to learn everything from your textbook. Avoid at all cost!
No teaching ability whatsoever. Writes down notes without explaining anything, do not take a class with her unless you are prepared to spend hours reteaching yourself from the textbook
she is challenged and can't teach for jack, learn from your textbook!

One of the best physics profs at SFU. His lectures are engaging, and he explains concepts clearly. Make sure to attend class, review material, and use resources like unstuckstudy - it really helps with the conceptual exams.
Hands down best prof I've had at SFU.

I love Professor Debenedictis. His lectures are so funny and his tests are very fair as well as his special grading system. I received the mark I deserved. Thank you, Professor! The questions at the end of the term get harder as electricity and magnetism are much harder than light and waves. So make sure to attend the midterm!

Dr. DeBenedictis is very helpful outside of class time. I enjoyed learning the content taught in PHYS 102. However, make sure you are constantly reviewing the material and doing the practice quizzes, as they make up a significant portion of your grade. I would recommend having this professor for your 100-level physics courses.

It was an absolute pleasure to take a course with Andrew. Such an amazing professor from a teaching standpoint and as a person too.Obviously physics is difficult but his lectures are engaging and he does a great job at explaining with zero judgement. Incredibly smart and easily one of the best profs at SFU. Someone come give this man a raise fr

andrew is such devoted professor. he loves the material he teaches and he does it well. sure he doesnt provide practice final exam but he has assigments, quizzes from other semesters. he also grades based on 3 schemes and which ever benefits you he gives you that grade. his exams are conceptual, so know how to use the formulas and youre good!
nice guy, enjoyable lectures with a lot of little demos, his quizzes and tests are all symbolic so make sure you understand the concept and not to memorize everything

Andrew is an extremely good and caring professor. His notes are clear and is good at explaining concepts. Tests and quizzes were conceptual. He reused some quiz questions on the tests. Tutorials are not mandatory. Ultimately, had a great time in the class and Andrew is an awesome professor.

I had Andrew for PHYS101 and was glad to see he was teaching 102 now. His online lectures include the neatest hand-written notes I've ever seen. He explains things very clearly, sometimes even a bit too much, but he just wants to make sure everyone is following along. I love the symbolic conceptual exams and not having to waste time on a calculator

Everyone has their own opinions on the way he teaches, but let me speak about him as a person. He's the most understanding Prof. I've ever had. He understands life difficulties for each individual and can make adjustments accordingly. No other Prof. I've had has done this. This guy is a true gem. Symbolic exams though, so study theoretically!

Hands down best online prof Ive had. Added a couple assignments to the course to take weight off the final. Clearly cares about our wellbeing studying online. Everything recorded, tutorial not mandatory, very descriptive helpful notes that read like hes talking to you. Midterm was just like the quizzes and hw. Highly recommend for online classes!

Andrew is an excellent professor who always is available to discuss with students their problems. He will even take physics questions that are not about the course material and always gives a respectable answer. Oh, and do sit in the front as he only writes on the chalkboard.

Be sure to sit at the front because Andrew writes on the chalkboards for his lectures! He is very good at breaking down complex topics and also shows how to derive almost all the equations we use. He obviously loves his work and never shows any judgment when you ask for help. An all-around great prof who is caring and will help you succeed!

Andrew is my fav physics prof in SFU. Very clear, friendly and understanding towards us. In addition, his office hours are useful. Homework is simple, and his exams are symbolic. If you take his class make sure you sit at the front since he provides chalk board notes. He pretty much makes first year physics enjoyable!

Wonderful instructor, until it comes to exams. MT and final have an unfair home-cooked question that is beyond what was done in class. Other than that, easy and fun, before the jump into that canyon. And hottest instructor on the planet.

its like they put the power of physics into Dio. Super cool guy, ALLWAYS helpful office hours even if its outside of office hours, lectures can be very confusing tho. Study his notes/examples hard and do your homework. He really rushed the second half of the course this semester so STUDY your magnets/electricity. GL
Best professor! Best lecturer! Really enjoyed his lectures. He explains so well that you don't need to study the text book on your own.
He's basically a wizard - does so many cool demonstrations in class and looks like a younger version of Dumbledore. If you've ever wished you went to school at Hogwarts, this is your guy.
Very helpful.
very organized prof. always available for extra help. however his exams are extreamly hard.

Excellent prof! Andrew is a savior for anyone who hates physics and simply has to take it for their degree. He has a simple approach to everything and is so patient and helpful it makes the entire process so much less painful. Fair exams, Very easy to talk to! Not at all condescending. Take him!
Awesome!

One of the best physics prof SFU has to offer. Good notes, and very helpful when you approach him. Easy and straight forward assignments. his exams are all symbolic. To do well on his tests just read the book and his notes and review his practice questions.
love the hair.
a fair, very helpful, excellent prof!  he doesn't trick you on the exams.  study his notes and go to the lecture and the course will be fine.
He is a funny prof...always being lazy, thats why he always gives easy test/quiz/assignemnts...everyone MUST find him for an easy physics credits!!
He's very helpful and makes the course interesting.  His exams are fair and easy!
blah

Worst prof I have ever had, till this day. Does not, at all, care about his students. Goes off on multiple tangents, talking about everything other than stuff on syllabus. Does not care if the material is sticking, and doesnt bother to offer extra help. First midterm was fair, the second midterm and final were terrible ! Do not recommend at all.

bro wtf was this class LMAO this was basically hell on earth. so much work like FR NO JOKE and the exams were planned to lower the average so please dont take it w nancy unless you want to kill yourself w the workload and material. DEADASS TAKE IT W ANDREW DEBENEDICTIS

this class demanded 9 hours of work a week outside of lecture (said by nancy herself). so exhausting...achieve has pre-lec assignments which is just the lecture taught on achieve and all she does in class is go over questions from pre-lecture. she doesn't teach you the content, you get that from achieve. i hated it so much.

Her recordings were trash. So much work for this class with pre lecture assignments to written homework. The pre lectures on achieve are basically the lecture so she only goes over questions from the pre lecture in class and doesn't teach the material herself. final exam was decent but I would avoid this prof and take Andrew debenedictis instead

Dr. Forde was the best physics prof I have ever had. Her exams are fair. Questions come from lectures and homework, so when I prepared I did well. If you are a non-physics major and need physics classes for your degree, I highly recommend taking them with Nancy.

she records lectures but if you're planning to rely on the recordings... don't. She mutes herself on accident half the time an the other half she won't even be recording the correct screen. Other than that she's okay. She emphasizes some topics but the exam might not even include what she emphasized.

Dr. Forde was a really good prof. We had 3 midterms/tests. The 1st was tough due to timing issues. She fixed timing for the other 2 which were better. The diffculty of the exams and final were just as hard as the achieve homework, written assignments and tutorial worksheets. She goes over examples in lecture. Understand HW, Written, tut easy A
Nancy is probably one of the most unpredictable profs I've ever had. She emphasizes certain things for her tests yet the exams throw you off guard. Hard marker - do not recommend.

Best physics prof. The material in the class is pretty dry but Nancy puts a lot energy into lectures and tries to put as many "real world" applications into the work as possible. Homework and lectures prepare you well for tests. The first test was clearly too difficult but she actually listened to feedback and made the rest of the tests more fair.

Lectures and pre lectures are conceptual, helpful for understanding the concepts and theories. However, the homework and assignments are on a whole different level. It requires methods/calculations that have not been introduced in lecture or we need to be experienced physics/math majors to comprehend. Constantly need external sources to understand.

Dr. Forde is an incredible professor. She was very kind and accessible, and made the class interesting and interactive. Welcomed questions and answered them thoroughly. Weekly homework took quite a bit of time, but was helpful for the most part. Exams were fair and somewhat interesting. I would 100% recommend taking a class with Dr. Forde!

Forde is a great professor. She really looks like she loves what she does and is great at keeping the lectures interesting. Her demos are relevant and do help you understand the material being taught. Her midterms were fair and with proper studying a good grade shouldn't be hard. However, her final was extremely difficult compared to her midterms.

Nancy is an amazing professor. I'm not the best at physics by any means but she makes the material interesting and keeps us engaged. The class is actually very difficult but Nancy puts in the extra effort to help if you take the time to ask. Would definitely recommend her for any physics course!

She always asks questions she didn't teach for tutorial worksheets, written assignments, masteringphysics, exams. There is A LOT of outside work for this class, despite it being worth 15% of your overall grade. Some of the course material is not in the textbook, and you would be better off learning this stuff from MIT open courseware. She uses it.
no formula sheet on 810 difficult midterms, the class is always lost but doesnt bother to elaborate, very inefficient with technology (overhead notes).

Hands down one of the worst lecturers I've had in university. No lectures slides, doesn't know how to use the technology in the lecture halls as she's still very adamant about scribbling down the entire course on an overhead project. Very unorganized and scatter-brained, gives the impression that she pretty much wings every lecture. Don't recommend

I made the mistake of not reading rate my prof before I took this class, worst decision,she is disorganized and she jumps from topic to topic, just overall difficult to follow. Don't take this class with her!

Try to avoid taking this class with jenifer thewalt. She feels the class isn't with her, but she still moves on with her notes. She requires you to take your own notes, memorize all the equations for the MT 1 and 2. I get home, read the notes I took and have no idea what's going on still, so I have to rely purely on the textbook.
I find her confusing, disorganized,and unhelpful. This is a very self-taught class. I would not take this class with her if you can avoid it!!

She is very helpful and enthusiastic. Her notes can be useful, but a lot of times she expects you to know more advanced information on the assignments or midterms than what she explained in class. Expect to read the textbook a lot for further clarification. If you put the time in you'll get a great grade because averages are low, I got an A+!

she writes out her notes; sometimes they're useful, most of the time they're not. the midterms and final were difficult with very low class averages. i only liked the fact that we had loncapa & not mastering of physics. i'd recommend NOT taking this class while she's teaching. otherwise you'll be self teaching the course via the textbook.

no formula sheet for the midterms, use lon capa instead of masteringphysics, and make the assignment due EARLIER in the week when the midterm is held. if you find out Jenifer Thewalt is gonna be your prof, WAIT FOR ANOTHER SEMESTER

Definitely the worst prof I have had so far after a year of university, I could really care less about physics being a "life sciences" course it is far to involved. Memorizing the formulas is horrible because it makes the course more memorization than application. Very disorganized often leaves important concepts untaught and as "Exercises".

A good prof if you go to office hours. In lectures she is always disorganized and confuses herself quite often. The text book is not required if you go to office hours and ask her what you need to know.  If you don't have a good understanding of physics before the class try to take it with another prof.

Although having to memorize the formulas is a pain, it really does help with understanding. If you know the formulas, you likely know how to apply them. The material in the course is fairly straightforward, although optics is somewhat dull.

Don't know what people are thinking, but don't take her class. Her lectures are so dry, and often times confusing (the textbook is actually helpful). As mentioned, no formula sheet (What's the point? Are we being tested on application or memorization), so if you take her class, start memorizing.

Although passionate, Thewalt is a very dry teacher who (as others have pointed out) has the unfortunate habit of denying formula sheets for a course that is often non-intuitive, and based on a large amount of formulas. Online assignments are relatively easy, written assignments often hard. Friendly yes, realistic? No. I hope you have a good memory.

Great prof. Best one Ive had so far. So kind so helpful so clear so smart ahhh. Just great. People dont like her because she doesn't give formula sheets but COME ON it's University not middle school!! Get used to the challenge! DEF RECOMMEND HER!

I do not understand how the class average for her m/t was 19/40, and she suggested it's basically our fault (none of hers whatsoever). Also, her notes were all over the place which did not help at all... since we weren't even given formula sheets on the exams. 
 
 Don't take her class. She's not a good physicist.

she is one of my favourite profs. she is very passionate in her teaching and is very responsive to students questions and comments. very engaging prof even when topics are dull. i definitely recommend her
Horrible teacher. Have to memorize 60+ formulas. midterms/finals are hard. Assignments are easy. Avg mark in her class this semester was a  fail. would never take her again
She is too busy amusing herself while teaching that she strides away from the fact that theres a about 300 kids watching her waddle back and forth from the projectors.

Hardest part about her class is that she makes you memorize all formulas. For me, that was most of my studying and i didnt know concepts as much as i could have. However, if you a slightly failing mark and have done all assignments, she will pass you.
she screws up on some questions....but maybe cause this is her first time teaching physics. anyways, she is nice and she gave me a good mark. so shes a good prof!

Decent professor. Sometimes she's lost for words, so lecture can get boring and slow-paced. Goes through most derivations and what you need to know for tests, but reading the textbook was key. Don't forget to do that.
 
 Midterms were fair, but had some tricky questions. Final was tough but fair. Must memorize all formulae, but that isn't too hard.
Worst prof ever. Have to memorize all the formulas, final exam questions doesn't even make any sense.  Her wording is horriable.  Doesn't seem like she know her stuff well enough. Notes are alright.
no website, no online notes, no forumula sheet, no explanation. this is a case of the prof not wanting to take the time to do those things that really help. hard class, bad prof, TAs are good though

Very nice prof, knows her stuff, but watch out for her final exam.  Very difficult, very time consuming, and...no formula sheet=memorizing a lot of formulas especially for magnetism, geometrical optics
SOOOOOOOOO HARD!!!

she's very nice and the lecture notes r too easy compared to things you need for the capa. u have to memorize all the formulas for midterms n final...n at the end they really add up. ther r many demos done during class, most of which i found quite useless but better than takin notes
she doesn't do scale. She said she usually makes tests at around "C" level. YA RIGHT! Her final was tough. Altough if you know what you are doing, you have lots of time to finish.
I thought she was an excellent professor. Definately one that doesn't hold your hand throught the course, but extremely helpful. I suck at physics and got an A+
She maybe an awesome prof for MBB, just dont take physics with her. It just doesnt work.
Horrible, I ended up with an A+, but no thanks to her (all textbook)
terrible prof. bad examples, very boring
Nice prof.
I m saying she is easy, but not hard!! BUt the problem is u need to memorize the formulas which many 102 profs do that too. SHe is nice and helpful. And she is very patient too.
the lectures are a bit boring but understandable the tests are too hard since we are expected to memorize the formulae which when it comes to the final, is just ridiculous
No Comments
possibly worst prof i've had. will give you solution for a question, which will consequently turn out to be completely wrong

Would be a better TA than prof. Irritating speech patterns. Forces you to memorize formulas as opposed to encouraging understanding. Tests become difficult as a result of poor teaching rather than hard questions. Too many demos.
notes are confusing, stutters when she talks, again notes are confusing...exams very hard
terrible prof.. boring as hell.  barely any demonstrations, nothing to keep you interested.
Jennifer is an excellent prof. She explains the course material in an easy and very understandable manner. Her exams and assignments are very easy.
Her course notes were a little bit confusing, but when you asked her questions one on one she was very helpful.
very nice prof. patient and organized, although she does sometimes lose track of where she is..=p  exams are hard, VERY HARD...especially the final exam, and she doens't normally scale the course...

Very nice; her lecture note is sometimes confusing; midterms and exams are reasonable; in compare to the TAs, the TAs devoted their time to help the students more than she does; rushed the materials at the end

Hard to follow notes, the textbook makes more sense. 
 Boring/slow. Always tries to squeeze things in at the end, goes overtime most lectures. Organized but lecture plans not thought out too well.
She's so nice, and very helpful.  Tries to make physics fun.  But its Physics...how fun can it get.  I like those films on Electric and Magnetic field.
very very very boring.  nice, helpful, but boring.
Awesome prof!! very clear and understandable... and nice!! nicest professor!

first time ever teaching a university class so ill give her some slack. I would recommend taking her class if your background knowledge in physics is good otherwise you will fail to learn new concepts she teaches you. Exams are poorly written although not challenging they dont test your physics knowledge. MC worth 4 marks does not seem correct

Only applies to surrey campus. Although George as a prof is alright, the way classes were structured were not optimal to say the least. Each class you had to complete an activity manual that was supposed help you implicitly learn certain concepts on your own. Lengthy nature of these manuals, meant you were playing catch up the entire semester.

NOTE: APPLIES ONLY TO SURREY CAMPUS. In each class, you'll do activity manuals. For the tests, he lets you bring those manuals in with you. Need I say more? As long as you take good notes on them, have a good grasp of the material and solid formula sheets on those manuals (note: use the back of one to make a combined sheet), you'll be fine.

Dr. Kirczenow is a good professor who is easy to approach.  Although unclear during certain lectures at times, he was willing to repeatedly go over main ideas until students understood them. The textbook is needed for homework, practice questions and reinforcing concepts. His tests were fair too, and overall there is not much to complain about.

Not bad for a physic prof. People say he's bad and all, but you have to remember it's physic. It's very hard to teach physic. I have to say though, he's not the most interesting person in the world. however, he do try his best.
The lectures were incomprehesible and disorganized but he is amazing at explaining concepts one-on-one. He's always willing to give you help if you ask for it.
helpful, but notes are not very useful
WTF was up with the final.  It way above in difficulty compared to the midterms.  Really unfair because I'm sure noone expected that :(.
Midterms were fair but the final exam was way too hard.  And his lecture notes suck.

Has really terrible lecture notes.  I stopped copying his notes after the 2nd week and studied myself from the textbook.  Midterms are fairly easy if you did your homework as it is based heavyily on the assignments.

Wonderful Teacher!. If you take Prof. Curzon's class make sure to write asides indicating important points. He is pretty straight forward and he follows the textbook, but does not reiterate the textbook. He likes to use variables in his examples, so that it can be applied to infinite number of problem sets.

The class was unorganized. He should have had prepared overheads. there were mistakes in several lectures, only to have him correct them later. He sent emails, often several times a day, sometimes to correct mistakes from the correction email. fill in blanks notes would save time give more time for examples of the difficulty level of the prob sets.

If YOU make an effort to speak to him about the troubles you are having with any questions.. he WILL go out of his way to help you as much as he can or untill you are satisfied. I like this guy for all the effort he puts in. =)

Terrible, when u know u have Curzon as a prof, i totally advise you to DROP the CLASS. I'm still choked that i paid for this class... he could be teaching Japanese for all i know - it's that unclear. He never defines any symbols and all the notes are undefined diagrams.

not a very good prof at all. makes assignments so hard and wants you to do everything in ink.  Class notes are NOT useful. have to read the textbook because his notes are not clear ><" makes me HATE physics even MORE!
Can't read his writing.
A great prof. Gave good notes and was always willing to help. Tough but fair exams. Super nice. All around great prof.
One of the nicest people EVER.  Is actually concerned about you LEARNING the material and not just memorizing formulae.  Fair exams.
has bad writing, but he's forgivable.  he made an effort to write clearer, and it's hard for his age.  very helpful and he gave us fair exams.
Great guy, difficult subject though.

I think as a person the guy is golden, very nice, firm believer in being a decent person. But as a prof, I found him patronizing, and quite rude. Writes a very long exam. The material wasn't hard but with no calc. etc... no time to finish exams.
Fair exams. Goes through assignments before they're due. Very helpful. Great prof. Very caring. Too bad he's retired.
this guys sucks. You can't read ANYTHING and his exams are so hard. Phys class and no calculations???? His exams are messed!
bad notes, bad writing, but funny at most times, good guy but midterms are hard.
Like Simon in American Idol says, this guy's  writing is dreadful!!!
Just do her homework,  mastering physics, and review her lecture notes. Some questions on the exam are very similar to homework questions. Easy for a physics class.

Easiest class ive ever taken, easy tests, easy homework, literally giving you free marks. if youre not doing good in her class its not her, its you. i put 2 hrs a week max into her class and  got an A. and shes hot af
Terrible. Online homework nearly unrelated to the exams

Experiments weren't always successful but as far as explaining material, pretty good compared to other physics profs. Organised lectures, but an excessive number of mastering physics questions each week, with sometimes  repeated or extremely similar questions asked more than once, which was frustrating considering the homework is graded.

Sabine is a nice teacher but she's also very boring, her voice is monotone which doesn't make the class seem interesting nor professional. Tutorials were okay but were not really that helpful as every session was not long enough with the amount of questions per week. The online homework was nearly irrelevant as the midterms were mostly conceptual.

Lectures are very clear and have some cool experiments/ humor to them. Exams have no tricks and were very fair, and honestly this course was much easier than 101 for me. She will always stop to further explain something further in class, and the tutotials/HW is well related. I enjoyed physics for the first time when I took it with her.

Sabine's a lovely prof. Straight-forward and always listens when students are confused. Grading and exam contents are fair, but not on the easy side. Her notes provide pretty much everything you need to know. Attendance is mandatory for i-clicker marks. Understand the weekly homework and tutorial, you will do just fine. Really enjoyed this course.
